text: The 2000-01 Austrian football championship was organized by the Austrian Football Bundesliga. The single-track First Division served as a substructure to the Bundesliga. The third performance level was represented by the regional leagues East (Vienna, Lower Austria, Burgenland), Middle (Upper Austria, Styria, Carinthia) and West (Salzburg, Tyrol, Vorarlberg). There was a special feature in the championship game Schwarz-Weiß Bregenz - Austria Vienna in the 9th round. Austria - Striker Christian Mayrleb violated the fairness rule by not playing the ball back to Bregenzer after intentionally playing out due to injury. Instead he scored a goal. The Austrian club president then ordered the game to be played again voluntarily. ==Final table== Pl. Name M W D L P 1\. FC Tirol Innsbruck 36 20 8 8 68 2\. SK Rapid Wien 36 16 12 8 60 3\. Grazer AK 36 16 9 11 57 4\. SK Sturm Graz 36 16 7 13 55 5\. FK Austria Wien 36 14 8 14 50 6\. SV Austria Salzburg 36 13 10 13 49 7\. SV Ried 36 13 9 14 48 8\.
